content.raw:
I believe the roadmap covers your concerns without the negative implications of a "work in progress" disclaimer. If you do want a "work in progress" disclaimer, then you should also decide when that disclaimer will be removed and include that information as well..

It's also easy to run down a overly negative hypothetical path. For example, I could also make the argument that a new user may read the "work in progress" disclaimer, and instead of trying out the code and adding features they go off and use Unreal never to return to Gazebo.
